title: armv7 rustc panic

labels.name: I-ICE
labels.description: Issue: The compiler panicked, giving an Internal Compilation Error (ICE) ❄️

labels.name: O-Arm
labels.description: Target: 32-bit Arm processors (armv6, armv7, thumb...), including 64-bit Arm in AArch32 state

labels.name: T-compiler
labels.description: Relevant to the compiler team, which will review and decide on the PR/issue.

body:
Had this happen after wrestling with a couple of my raspberry pis failing to compile my project which has been compiling fine in the past. Unfortunately, this happened once out of about 20 retries to compile and I have not been able to reproduce. The problem occurs not only on the toml crate as in this paste, but with others such as syn, proc-macro2, serde_derive, which gives me the impression this has something to do with the procedural macros.

```
error: Could not compile `toml`.
warning: build failed, waiting for other jobs to finish...
error: internal compiler error: librustc/ty/subst.rs:140: impossible case reached

thread 'rustc' panicked at 'Box<Any>', librustc_errors/lib.rs:535:9
note: Run with `RUST_BACKTRACE=1` for a backtrace.

note: the compiler unexpectedly panicked. this is a bug.

note: we would appreciate a bug report: https://github.com/rust-lang/rust/blob/master/CONTRIBUTING.md#bug-reports

note: rustc 1.25.0 (84203cac6 2018-03-25) running on armv7-unknown-linux-gnueabihf

error: Could not compile `proc-macro2`.

```
